name: Jules Waller
goals: Defend someone accused of being the killer at least once.
flaws: Has poor awareness of personal space; will randomly leave the group and return later, lying about where you were.
backstory: Julia is a river-bed runner who journals exclusively in bullet points. She quotes UNITY like a mantra and fondly recalls her first team codename, Pallas—because some names just stick.

name: Conan Sol
goals: Organize a team huddle that only ends when everyone does a chant (e.g., all hands in the middle, yelling 'go team!').
flaws: Has an abrasive personality and constantly disagrees with everyone.
backstory: Conall treats code reviews like choreography and practices Wing Chun to reset his brain between builds. He once named variables after pasta shapes; his kid’s middle name is Ada, because of course it is.

name: Isla Browne
goals: Create a secret hand language with another player and use it as often as possible without anyone else knowing what you're saying.
flaws: Whenever an accusation is made, they are unsure if it's the right decision.
backstory: Isabelle speaks in headlines and thinks every crisis can become a good rebrand. She’s building a scrapbook called “Birds That Could Be Logos,” sourced all over Boulder. If you hear “we can spin this,” she’s warming up.

name: Jed Bavis
goals: Convince one person that the person they suspect isn't the killer.
flaws: Is 'seeing things'; keeps distracting people by pointing out random things (real or fake) in the area.
backstory: Jeb runs on black coffee and log lines. He wears a patch that just says grep and can route a parade through an alley without breaking stride. If a cat appears, he will sneeze and apologize to it.

name: Diego Rodrigo
backstory: Elena is a sunscreened sleuth with a pelican case labeled “Evidence & Snacks.” She quotes her mentor SIFU K like scripture and will evangelize SPF 50 as if it’s a life philosophy.

name: Mason Reyd
goals: Use your coin for the game as often as possible.
flaws: You're an addicted gambler; everything needs to be a bet with you.
backstory: Sam collects transit tokens and writes tiny maps of good shade spots. Decisions are made with a dramatic flip of a silver coin, then dutifully logged in a pocket notebook labeled “maybe.” Spent a sun-splashed summer in Boise cataloging benches by vibe.

name: Vance Whit
backstory: Urban bench cartographer who rates outdoor seats by “elbow diplomacy” and pigeon diplomacy. Keeps a pocket UV pen for spotting cool signage and has a scrapbook of curbside typography.

name: Lola Impato
goals: Convince the group to take a vote on who they think the killer is.
flaws: You're larger than life; embellish your backstory whenever you can.
backstory: Opal’s a boardroom closer with café-kid energy—she still judges foam like a latte-art referee and claims every problem has a “cortado solution” (short, strong, clean). Weekend hobby: negotiating peace treaties between rival trivia teams.

name: Luke Juno
goals: Get accused of being the killer at least once.
flaws: Convince the group to adopt a buddy system and then break it once.
backstory: Lukey is a bike-route speedrunner whose bell is tuned to A440. He claims you can “draft” behind pedestrians and has named three shortcuts after himself.

name: Aria Shaw
goals: Get two different players to vouch for your location in the last 10 minutes.
flaws: You don't like to overshare; make it hard for people to get your backstory out of you.
backstory: Sarah carries a tiny stamp that says “nope” and edits commas mid-sprint. Her mural motto is NEIGHBORLY, and yes, her surname is Shaw—you’ll hear it when she corrects your forms.

name: Janis Hadley
backstory: Nefeli treats cafés like libraries and can discuss ten kinds of cortado foam with alarming precision. Her favorite board-game alias is Pallas, and she grew up under Tempe sunsets collecting cool typefaces from street signs.

name: Lana Solan
flaws: Bad at directions; convince the group to go the wrong way as many times as you can.
backstory: Lala is a brand witch with glitter tape and a waffle-iron sticker that reads “Liège or leave.” She has three kinds of confetti: launch, relaunch, and “oops but make it viral.”

name: Nate Hankey
backstory: Nathan rescues vintage keyboards, names them after mountains, and insists he can smell lithium from ten feet. He grew up in Bismarck, loves command-line jokes, and treats grep like a lifestyle brand.

name: Zara Niles
goals: You're a runner, you're a track star; convince the group to run somewhere twice.
flaws: Support all accusations that you can.
backstory: Zarine carries color-coded sticky tabs and can summon volunteers by clapping on two and four. Her knack for “herding cats” is so strong she once accidentally scheduled a flash-mob cleanup.

name: May Rae
goals: Convince someone to go off with you in a group of two at least once.
flaws: At the beginning of the game, choose someone you're convinced is the killer (and don't change this).
Convince as many people as you can that they are the killer throughout the game.
backstory: Maya runs A/B tests on her socks. She interned at a lithium startup, hails from Fremont, and believes PCRE is a love language.

name: Lex Ace
goals: Insist you need to be the first to scan the nfc tag at lease once.
flaws: cant be alone pick a player at the start of the game and never leave their side no matter what
backstory: Lex Ace walks like a floor plan and travels with a pocket color deck flipped to **Pantone 1585** by default. She once measured wind direction using only a tote bag and a squint.

name: Cal Bonamo
goals: Accuse someone of being the killer at least once (if you dont know who the killer is LIE)
flaws: you like to walk slowly constantly convince the group your with to walk slower.
backstory: Calvin is a spreadsheet sommelier who swirls pivot tables and says things like “notes of compliance.” He framed his toughest auditor’s surname on the wall like a championship belt: **Arkady**.

name: Colter Wren
goals: Stick to your guns if you say something and its ends up being incorrect
flaws: GASLIGHT GATEKEEP GIRL BOSS as many times as you can convince people they said something they never said.
backstory: Cole is a human diff tool who dreams in lookaheads. Favorite regex flavor is **PCRE** for reasons he’ll happily explain at length.

name: Rey Cavallo
goals: Double check just to make sure
don't take peoples word ask for clarification.
flaws: convince one person they need to go find someone else desperately. Lie about the reason and if they ask you why you did that lie some more.
backstory: Avery chats with intersections like old friends and keeps a scale model of a **Volvo XC90** on the desk. Surname **Cavallo**; favorite weather is “crisp map-folding breeze.”

name: Drew Winard
goals: Get three people to use the same **exact phrase** you coin
flaws: You think this game is deeper than it is. After solving a clue convince the group your with that there is more to that clue and your missing something.
backstory: Drew Winard treats the city like a living dashboard he logs odd hums with a pocket field recorder, taps street poles in 5/4 to “calibrate,” and claims you can trace group confusion like a network packet. Favorite tee says YAGNI, and when things get crunchy he mutters, “hold on, I’ll strace this.”
